medical_history.chief_complaint: RUQ abdominal pain with associated symptoms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms started abruptly 4 days ago while at work after eating an egg. Pain is described as achy, severe, constant, and worsens with eating. Associated with non-bilious, non-bloody vomiting, anorexia, subjective fever/chills, dark and foul-smelling urine, and maroon stools, persisting for 3 days. Previous similar episode occurred with sudden onset.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Atrial fibrillation on Apixaban, hypertension, depression, hyperparathyroidism, morbid obesity, history of laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass, no other abdominal surgeries.
medical_history.family_history: Father has a history of gallbladder attacks; siblings include a liver transplant sister (alcohol abuse) and a liver transplant brother.
medical_history.social_history: History of alcohol abuse; no recent travel or sick contacts reported.
